name: seafood pastilla
ingredients: 250 g of small pastilla sheets or brick sheets
300 g of white fish cut into large cubes
80 g of pitted green olives cut into small pieces
1/4 of a preserved lemon cut into pieces
steps: Sauté the squid and shrimp in 3 tbsp of butter over high heat (2-3 min). Set aside.
Sauté the white fish cubes in 2 tbsp of butter (2-3 min). Set aside.
Heat the olive oil and sauté the onion, garlic, mushrooms, harissa, olives, and spices (5 min). Add the preserved lemon, parsley, and coriander.
Soak the vermicelli in hot water, drain, and cut it. In a large bowl, mix the fish, seafood, vermicelli, and vegetable mixture. Add the lemon juice.
Shaping: Butter a small mold. Line it with a brick sheet, brush it with butter. Cover with a second sheet. Fill with stuffing. Fold the edges. Cover with a final sheet.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C. Remove from the oven as soon as they turn golden. Serve hot.
